title: Berlin truck attack suspect Anis Amri shot dead in Milan - BBC News
summary: berlin market attack suspect anis amri has been shot dead by police in milan , prosecutors say .
police say he was approached by officers during a routine patrol in the sesto san giovanni area on friday .
one police officer was injured in the shoot-out but his life is not in danger .
german officials have confirmed amri 's fingerprints were found inside the truck used in monday 's attack .
twelve people were killed and 49 wounded in berlin on monday evening .

documents.title: live coverage ends
text: we are ending our live coverage but you can keep up to date with developments in our news story .

documents.title: criticism over identifying police
text: # italy 's interior minister # minniti hailed for operation that killed # anisamri - but some criticise release of details of policemen involved
if you trace amris ' last journey , there will be accomplices at every stop .
he 'd left tracers behind .
find those cells .
it does seem to have been a very pointless and potentially repercussion-risking thing to have done .

documents.title: eurosceptics question schengen agreement
text: leading eurosceptics have blamed the schengen agreement , which allows passport-free travel between many european union states , for anis amri 's easy journey across europe .
the berlin truck attack suspect travelled by train from germany to france and on to italy , where he was killed in a shoot-out with police .

marine le pen , who leads france 's far-right national front party , said : `` this escapade in at least two or three countries is symptomatic of the total security catastrophe that is the schengen agreement . ''
former ukip leader nigel farage said on twitter : `` if the man shot in milan is the berlin killer , then the schengen area is proven to be a risk to public safety .
it must go . ''

documents.title: uk security stepped up after attack
text: security around the uk has been stepped up after the berlin attack .

in london , roads will be closed around buckingham palace during the changing of the guard ceremony , while armed officers will be on duty in newcastle , the east midlands and other cities around the country .

documents.title: milan police 'not acting on tip-off '
text: police had no information that anis amri might have travelled to milan , the city 's police chief says .
reports have suggested that patrols in the city were stepped up following a tip-off that the berlin market attack suspect might be in the area .
but antonio de iesu said the officers who encountered amri were on a routine patrol .
`` we had no intelligence that he could be in milan , '' he told reporters .
`` they had no perception that it could be him otherwise they would have been much more cautious . ''

documents.title: appeal raises more than £ 50,000 for lorry driver
text: a campaign to raise money for the family of the polish lorry driver lukasz urban , who died in monday 's attack , has gained more than £ 50,000 in donations .
the online crowdfunding push was started by `` fellow trucker '' dave duncan from otley , west yorkshire , with 3,700 people offering money .

documents.title: did amri have any accomplices ?
text: german 's federal prosecutor , peter frank , has told a news conference that investigators are still trying to determine whether anis amri had help from any accomplices .

documents.title: two terror arrests in germany
text: a new terror alert has been sparked in germany after two men were arrested on sus of planning an attack on a shopping centre in oberhausen near the dutch border .
the brothers , aged 31 and 28 and born in kosovo , were detained early on friday in duisburg , police say .

documents.title: berlin police thank milan counterparts
text: berlin police have tweeted their thanks to their italian counterparts , following the shoot-out in milan in which berlin christmas market attack suspect anis amri was killed .
`` thanks and a speedy recovery to our wounded colleagues , '' said the tweet in italian and german on the berlin police twitter feed .

author: BBC Monitoring
News from around the globe

documents.title: freedom or security , berlin asks
text: the bbc 's damien mcguinness has been looking at the impact of the berlin attack on life there .
for many berliners , the one word most associated with their city is `` freedom '' .
so when berlin mayor michael mueller called this tragedy an `` attack on our freedom '' , he meant an attack on the essential character of this city .
you can read more of damien 's article here .

documents.title: parents 'proud ' of policeman
text: the parents of italian trainee police officer luca scata , who shot anis amri , have told italian news agency ansa that they are `` extremely proud '' of him .

documents.title: police officers ' base
text: this is the police station in # sestosangiovanni near # milan where the two police officers - hailed as heroes by pm # gentiloni - are based

documents.title: amri 's mother : 'it hurts so much '
text: anis amri 's mother has hit out at european authorities following the shooting of her son in milan .
the security people in italy and germany are also partly responsible , '' nour el houda hassani said in an interview with german newspaper deutsche welle from her home in tunisia .
`` they had already caught him two or three times [ before the berlin attack ] .
why did they not send him back to tunisia ?
why was he not sentenced ?
why was he not arrested ? ''
she added : it hurts so much .
how could such a thing happen ?
i feel so bad for the innocents and also for my son . ''
author: BBC Monitoring
News from around the globe

documents.title: italian pm praises officers
text: italian prime minister paolo gentiloni has praised the two young officers involved in the shoot-out .
`` italy is proud of its security forces , '' he was quoted as saying by la stampa website .
`` we 're especially grateful to the young officer on probation cristian movio , who was wounded , and to his colleague luca scata .
the .
officers demonstrated outstanding courage and professionalism . ''
author: BBC Monitoring
News from around the globe

documents.title: detailed view of shoot-out location
text: detailed view of shoot-out location

documents.title: amri encounter 'probably more than luck '
text: security correspondent frank gardner has told the news channel that the encounter with anis amri was `` probably more than luck '' .
`` italy was on alert for this guy , he had spent four years in italy mostly in jail , and he was known already to the italian authorities , '' he said .
`` there was a degree of international co-operation here .
`` he probably made a mistake going back to italy , he would have been probably trying to hide himself in the suburbs or indeed trying to get himself over to syria .
`` it could have been luck but i suspect it was more of a tip-off . ''

documents.title: amri 'travelled to milan from france '
text: railway tickets found on amri 's body showed he had travelled from chambery in south-eastern france to turin and then on to milan , italy 's ansa news agency says .
police had stepped up patrols in milan following a tip off that amri might be in the area , judicial sources quoted by reuters say .

documents.title: who were the victims of the attack ?
text: details have started to emerge of some of the people who lost their lives in monday 's attack .
they included polish lorry driver lukasz urban , israeli tourist dalia elyakim and italian expatriate fabrizia di lorenzo .

documents.title: merkel and tunisian president to talk
text: a german government spokeswoman says chancellor angela merkel will speak by phone to the tunisian president beji caid essebsi later on friday .
the deportation of rejected asylum seekers will be discussed , reuters reports .
tunisian-born amri was facing deportation in june this year , but remained in germany because of a delay in receiving paperwork from tunisia .

documents.title: italian pm told merkel of shooting
text: italian prime minister paolo gentiloni has told a news conference that he called german chancellor angela merkel to tell her that anis amri had been killed .
mr gentiloni said it underlined the importance of increased collaboration at national and international levels .
mrs merkel 's spokeswoman earlier declined to comment until written confirmation had arrived from rome .

documents.title: bloodstains visible on pavement
text: blood stains on the pavement outside # milan station where # anisamri was killed by italian police overnight # berlinattack

documents.title: what we know so far about attack
text: the attack on the christmas market in berlin took place on monday evening - but what do we know so far ?
twelve people were killed and 49 injured , with 18 of those in a critical condition .
so-called islamic state ( is ) said the following day that one of its `` soldiers '' carried out the attack on breitscheidplatz christmas market , but offered no evidence .

documents.title: italian security working well , says minister
text: italian interior minister marco minniti has praised the officers involved , saying : `` as soon as this person entered our country he was the most wanted man in europe and we immediately identified him and neutralised him and this means our security is working really well . ''

documents.title: more details on shooting
text: italian police say that when stopped , amri pulled a gun from his backpack , shouted `` god is greatest '' in arabic and opened fire , injuring an officer .
a second policeman with only nine months ' service returned fire , killing him , they add .

documents.title: german newspapers react
text: german newspapers have been quick to report the news about the killing of ansi amri in milan .
the tabloid bild says : it 's over !
terror suspect anis amri shot dead in milan

documents.title: chalk marks scene of shootout
text: circle of chalk can be seen at location outside # sestosangiovanni train station in # milan where # anisamri was shot dead overnight

documents.title: milan thrust into truck attack investigation
text: journalists are gathering near the scene of the shootout in milan .
amri had lived in italy before he moved to germany in 2015 and sought asylum

documents.title: italian authorities speak
text: the bbc 's bethany bell reports on what the italian authorities have said about the shooting in milan .

documents.title: amri 'by himself when stopped '
text: producer julian miglierini , who is at the scene in milan , says it appears that amri was walking by himself , after arriving from france , when he was stopped by police near the railway station in sesto san giovanni , a working class suburb of milan .

documents.title: deadly shoot-out with police in milan
text: italian news agency ansa says amri was killed in a shoot-out with police early on friday in milan 's sesto san giovanni neighbourhood following a routine check .

documents.title: italy confirms berlin suspect shot dead
text: in the past few minutes , italy 's interior minister marco minniti has confirmed that berlin truck attack suspect anis amri has been shot and killed by police in milan .
